conclusion: Analyze forces on object A and deformation of springs.
Initially, object A is at rest under gravity and spring B.
Force exerted by spring B balances weight of A: k1 x1 = mg.
Spring B is compressed by 9.8 cm initially.
When spring C is pulled to position b, tension force of spring B equals gravitational force of A.
Spring B is stretched by x2: k1 x2 = mg.
Total change in length of spring B: x2 - (-x1) = 19.6 cm.
Object A has risen by 19.6 cm.
Horizontal displacement of right endpoint of spring C is 60 cm.
Left endpoint of spring C also displaced by 60 cm due to inextensible rope.
Spring C is stretched by 60 cm.
Force exerted by spring C: FC = k2 x 0.6 m.
Force by spring C equals weight of A: k2 x 0.6 = 19.6.
Final answer: height A rises is 19.6 cm, stiffness coefficient k2 is 32.67 N/m.
